title: Calories in a Biscuit
meta_description: Discover calories in a biscuit, including macros like carbs, protein, and fat, plus per-biscuit nutrition facts and simple tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard buttermilk biscuit, baked from scratch or mix, about 2-inch diameter and 60g; no added toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by recipe, brand, size, flour type, and baking method. Check labels for packaged biscuits.

quick_answer.text: One standard biscuit has about 212 kcal, with 26 g carbs and 4 g protein.

label_note: Values mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaged products.

faqs.q: How many calories in a biscuit?
faqs.a: Approximately 212 kcal for one standard buttermilk biscuit.

faqs.q: What are the carbs in a biscuit?
faqs.a: About 26 g total carbs, including 1 g fiber and 2 g sugars per biscuit.

faqs.q: Is a biscuit high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 450 mg per biscuit due to baking powder and salt in the recipe.

faqs.q: How does biscuit size affect calories?
faqs.a: Larger biscuits (e.g., 3-inch) can add 50-100 kcal; smaller ones less.
Traditional ones contain wheat flour; gluten-free versions use alternative flours but may vary in nutrition.
